column4: Hi ! I'm having problems with the buttons on my logitech MX510 mouse. My xorg.conf lies here http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/53446/
is this correct setup?
I would skip buttons 4 and 5 in the buttons mapping thingy since they are used for scroll
So Buttonconfig = 1 2 3 6 7
so will the scrollingwheel work normally then? I've pretty much tried anything
yes, I think so.. can't really remember what I used for my logitech mouse.. apparently those settings are gone now.. don't know when they were removed
I've pretty much followed every single guide out there ;)
what is it that isn't working with that config?
back and forth in Opera for instance
I'm also unable to scroll webpages
The buttons work, but they are not correctly mapped
thumb-button pointing downwards scrolls the webpage down......
that's what you can change in that line there.... I'm not sure how you can see what button you've pressed down..
perhaps some kind of X debugging software
I think it's something with "event"
imwheel --config
imwheel reports button 6 ad 7 for wheel
and what if you put 6 7 for scroll.. doesn't that make it work?
I've changed it to 1 2 3 6 7 now, everything else is the same
ok
Didn't solve my problem
ok, hang on.. I'll see if I can find that command I used again
upper thumb button scrolls down, lower scrolls up, mwheel goes back and forth in history
try running "xev" in a terminal.. and press some buttons in the window that pops up
